summary: In Greek mythology, Eros is the god of love and desire. He is often shown as a handsome young man with wings, carrying a bow and arrows. With these arrows, he makes people fall in love, including gods and mortals. Eros is sometimes a mischievous boy, always with his mother, Aphrodite. He is part of a group called the Erotes, winged love gods. The Roman version of Eros is called Cupid. Their images, known as Putti, later inspired the cherubs seen in Christian art.
title: Eros
